result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Flasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony J. Flasch is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Anthony J. Flasch was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Anthony J. Flasch was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 2:36 PM. State gives plea agreement, ct 1 & ct 4, ct 1 withheld sentence 5 years probation, AODA and follow through, costs, ct 4 - 4 months jail, Parties talk about jail credit, 79 days credit on ct 4. Huber privileges.  Atty Schuster heard on start of jail time. Atty Schuster does not have must argument because joint recommendation.  State gives sentencing recommendation. Atty Schuster gives sentencing recommendation.   Def. makes statement.  Court accepts plea agreement and orders on 
Ct. 1 - withheld sentence 5 years probation, costs, AODA and follow through with recommendation and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent, costs, 250 DNA surcharge, DNA Sample
Ct 4, 4 months jail, Credit 79 days served, costs, $200.00 DNA Surcharge, Huber privileges, C. no later than 9-20-16 @ 7 pm., State heard on surcharge on ct 4, Court will not order surcharge on ct 4 for DNA, May be served in other county, no electronic monitoring.  Bond applied to costs and DNA surcharge on ct 1 and balance to be returned to S.I. poster.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights. DNA form.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court via video, with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuster as to why he failed to appear.  Request warrant be vacated and reinstate bond.  State request warrant be vacated also and reinstate bond.  Court will reinstate bond, warrant vacted  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica L Schuster in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:04 p.m. Scheduled for sentencing hearing. Atty Schuster was informed that Def is in custody in another county. State asks for body only warrant, Langlade and adjacent counties. Atty Schuster requests matter be rescheduled. Court authorizes warrant, body only, statewide. 
State not requesting bond forfeiture at this time.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF246, 15CF40 and 14CT85 @ 4:09 p.m. State moves to amend ct 1 of 14CF246 - amended information filed. Def will plead to 1 & 4, move to dismiss cts 2 & 3 w/prejudice and cts 5 & 6 dismiss and read in.  15CF40 dismiss and read in. 14CT85 dismiss without prejudice. 14CF246 -Ct 1 - withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, costs. Def bound to recommend no less than 3 yrs probation.  Ct 4 - State will recommend 8 months jail. Def to recommend not less than 4 months jail. Response by Atty Schuster, willing to agree to 5 yr probation and 4 months jail if State is willing. State agrees. Atty Schuster explains why sentencing will not be today. State explains reasons for agreement. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to14CF246 ct 1 as amended - no contest. Plea to ct 4 - no contest. 14CF246 dismissed w/prejudice ct2 & 3, ct 5 & 6 DRI. 14CT85 - dismissed w/out prejudice for reasons stated. 15CF40 - all cts dismissed and read in. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Schuster satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of cts 1 & 4 of amended complaint.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF40, 14CT85 & 14CF246  @ 11:30 am. 14CT85 Stipulate for hearing probable cause to arrest for OWI however the consent.  Court will hear motion to suppress on 14CT85.  Kyle Rustick, Police Officer for City of Antigo, duly sworn on oath, testifies. State Exhibit #1 - Informing the Accused. State rest.  Atty Schuster would like Officer to check if audio.  Atty Schuster will file brief. Court will do an oral ruling.  State replys to brief. Court finds no grounds & will deny motion.  State will comply with demands, if audio is available court will reserve defense right to refile motion. Atty Schuster may brief.  14CF246 State will agree to dismiss ct's 2 & 3.  Atty Schuster motion will be granted & dismiss ct's 2 & 3. Court will dismiss ct's 2 & 3 without prejudice.  15CF40 State amends Ct 2 attempt mnf amphetamine, as repeater, State will draft an amended information. Court will grant leave to amend ct 2 & reserve defense right to be heard.  State Exhibit #1 in 14CT85 received. Atty Schuster heard on schuduling. 14CT85 set for trial. Both 2014 cases to be set for status & follow.
Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CT85, 14CF2146 and 15CF40 @ 9:44 a.m. Waiver of prelims filed for 14CF246 and 15CF40. Court reviews prelim waivers with Def, finds waivers knowingly and voluntarily made, finds probable cause and binds over. Informations filed. Copies received, reading waived. Not guilty pleas to all counts in both. Def requests reduction in bond. Arguments given by Atty Schuster, asks bond reduced to $2,000, $500 already posted. Response by State, objects to reducing bond. Court grants motion, gives reasons. $2,000.00 cash bond covers all three files, with conditions continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court vai video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuster, to hold until later or partial forfeiture.  Response by state to forfeit entire bond, reasons given.  Court will forfeit $1500.00 and $500.00 will remain.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CF89, 14CF246, and 14CT85 @ 2:09 p.m. 14CF89 DOC report recommendation is ct 1 - 90 days jail, ct 2 - 30 days jail concurrent, State agrees, $930.30 court obligations to civil judgment. Atty Schuster has no objection, advises 94 days jail credit. Court has reviewed report. Orders ct 1 - 90 days jail, ct 2 - 30 days jail, concurrent to ct 1. Civil judgments for obligations. 94 days sentence credit. 14CF246 - Bond hearing - Statement by Atty Schuster, asks for reduction of cash bond. Response by State. Court denies request. 14CF246 and 14CT85 - status conference 3/2/15 @ 3:30 p.m.

Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in court via video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Anthony J. Flasch in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Time limit for preliminary hearing waived.  State request cash bond.  Response by Atty Schuster for lower cash bond or signature bond.  Bond set by court.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
